author: TravisEz13
body:
## PR Summary

Make it easier and clearer how and what to mark as not applicable in the PR Template:

- make not applicable a separate checkbox
- move the simpler items first
- make one item just an instruction, not a checkbox
- add copyright header item

## PR Checklist

- [x] [PR has a meaningful title](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - Use the present tense and imperative mood when describing your changes
- [x] [Summarized changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [x] [Change is not breaking](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#making-breaking-changes)
- [x] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` to the beginning of the title and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.
- **User-facing changes**
    - [x] Not Applicable
    - **OR**
    - [ ] User-facing [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
        - [ ] Issue filed - Issue link:
- **Testing - New and feature**
    - [x] Not Applicable
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)
        - [ ] [Add `[feature]` if the change is significant or affects feature tests](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/testing-guidelines/testing-guidelines.md#requesting-additional-tests-for-a-pr)

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body:
I always find that ticking the first 3 checkboxes is a pointless exercise. They should be just one checkbox stating something like `PR summary/title follows rules here` with a link to a more or less detailed document section describing it.
You cannot force people to do stuff (or get better results) by having more checkboxes. The best example is your 'summary' that is a copy paste of the title. I also did not find the title meaningful at all because I only knew what it was about the PR template once I looked at the diff.
The other improvements I find good though, sorry for ranting.
I only have 1 question: why do you need NA specifically? If a checkbox is not ticked then can one not assume that it is not applicable?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
@bergmeister I agree partially on the first 3 checkboxes and updated the checklist, but just because we can't force people doesn't mean we can't remind them.  As a maintainer, the results are much better with the checklist.

The problem with using unchecked as not applicable could mean they haven't gotten around to it or that it's not applicable, but I think I would be ok with it.  I added the maintainers and Steve for additional feedback.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Should we add a point for [Breaking Change] in commit header? I already lost one.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I think the breaking change in the commit header is a maintainer requirement.

title: Make it clearer how and what to mark as not applicable
